user_input: How does the EU General Data Protection Regulation influence the binding process for age assurance results?
reference_contexts:
['Generated on 17/05/2025
The solution applies the following Binding process:
The binding of the age assurance result to the subject is managed either through anonymised persistent identiﬁers or
pseudonymised session tokens, depending on service conﬁguration.
For services requiring a durable user context, we utilise unique, anonymised account identiﬁers, scoped to each
relying party. These identiﬁers are generated and stored in a manner that prevents re-identiﬁcation and contain no
PII. They allow the age assurance result to be persistently associated with the correct subject, while remaining
unlinkable outside the scope of the speciﬁc service.
For session-only implementations, the age assurance result is associated with a temporary, pseudonymised session
token, which is discarded at the end of the session lifecycle. No persistent user records are retained by the age
assurance provider.
All bindings are protected using cryptographically secure mechanisms to prevent tampering, misuse, or unauthorised
reuse. This approach supports privacy-by-design principles and aligns with international best practice, including
ISO/IEC 27566 and ISO/IEC 29100 requirements for data minimisation, unlinkability, and integrity of personal data
processing.
 The solution achieves Privacy and data protection as follows:
AgeChecked operates under the principles of the UK GDPR and Data Protection Act 2018, and takes into account the
requirements of the EU General Data Protection Regulation (EU GDPR), relevant US privacy laws including the
California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) and Children’s Online Privacy Protection Act (COPPA), the Australian Privacy
Act 1988, Canada’s Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA), and Argentina’s Ley de
Protección de los Datos Personales (Law No. 25.326). Our systems are designed to uphold the highest standards of
privacy across jurisdictions, with a strong emphasis on data minimisation, transparency, and user rights.
 Data minimisation: Only the minimal information necessary for assurance is collected—typically a date of birth or
pseudonymous token. No biometric data or government-issued ID is stored by default.
 Purpose limitation: Data is processed solely for the purpose of age assurance and is not reused for unrelated
commercial proﬁling or behavioural targeting.
 Transparency and control: Users are informed of what data is processed and for what purpose via our public privacy
policy. Users can exercise their rights to access, rectify, or erase their data through a clearly deﬁned DPO contact
channel.
']
reference: The EU General Data Protection Regulation influences the binding process for age assurance results by ensuring that the binding is managed through anonymised persistent identifiers or pseudonymised session tokens, which prevents re-identification and contains no personally identifiable information (PII). This approach supports privacy-by-design principles and aligns with international best practices, including requirements for data minimisation, unlinkability, and integrity of personal data processing.
response: The provided context does not contain information about how the EU General Data Protection Regulation influences the binding process for age assurance results.

user_input: How does the Age Check Certification Scheme ensure compliance and reliability in age assurance systems?
reference_contexts:
["Generated on 28/02/2025
 The solution protects human rights in the following ways:
Our age assurance system is built on a foundation of robust security, ethical data practices, and accessible design.
Our lightweight, compiled C++ shareable object—integrated seamlessly with WASM, Swift, Kotlin, and
Python—ensures that all biometric processing occurs securely on the user’s device, eliminating data exposure risks.
Our machine learning models are trained exclusively on 100% ethically sourced data, which includes real, consented
images alongside synthetic image sets. This approach not only guarantees accuracy and fairness but also upholds
high ethical standards in data collection and usage.
Accessibility and inclusion are central to our design. The user interface features intuitive graphics and imagery that
are easily understood by users of all ages. Real-time user guidance provides clear, step-by-step instructions
throughout the veriﬁcation process, ensuring that both children and adults can navigate the UI/UX eﬀortlessly. This
design minimizes barriers and prevents undue restriction of access to essential services such as news, health, and
education.
In summary, our age assurance solution combines secure on-device processing, ethically trained machine learning
models, and a user-friendly, accessible interface to provide a reliable and inclusive age veriﬁcation experience for all
users to protect human rights.
The solution has been subject to audit, certiﬁcation and review in the following ways:
Our age assurance system is rigorously monitored and evaluated through continuous internal and customer-led
auditing, as well as independent third-party certiﬁcation. We perform ongoing audits that assess performance,
security, and bias, ensuring that our solution consistently meets the highest performance standards with the lowest
MAE in the industry. In parallel, our customers conduct their own audits to conﬁrm our system's reliable performance
and to rigorously monitor for bias to ensure consistent outcomes.
Additionally, our technology is independently tested and certiﬁed under the Age Check Certiﬁcation Scheme (ACCS),
where we have achieved EAL 3 certiﬁcation.
The PrivateID ML team is also dedicated to continually enhancing our models' performance.
This comprehensive approach—encompassing continuous internal and external audits along with third-party
certiﬁcation—ensures that our age assurance system maintains the highest accuracy, speed and unbiased decisioning
while maintaining complete user privacy.
"]
reference: The Age Check Certification Scheme (ACCS) ensures compliance and reliability in age assurance systems through rigorous monitoring and evaluation, including continuous internal and customer-led auditing, as well as independent third-party certification. The technology is independently tested and certified under the ACCS, achieving EAL 3 certification, which confirms the system's reliable performance and adherence to high standards.
response: The Age Check Certification Scheme ensures compliance and reliability in age assurance systems by providing a structured framework for evaluating and certifying these systems. This involves assessing the systems against established standards and criteria to ensure they accurately verify the age of users. The scheme likely includes rigorous testing, auditing, and continuous monitoring to maintain high levels of accuracy and trustworthiness in age verification processes.

user_input: What are the key features and privacy measures implemented by Private Identity LLC as an Age Assurance Provider?
reference_contexts:
['ISO 27566-1 Practice Statement
Solution Owner: Private Identity LLC
Private Identity LLC is a(n) Age Assurance Provider (an entity responsible for providing age assurance results to a
relying party)
This is a practice statement for the age assurance solution known as Age Assurance
The system and practice statement are kept under continuous and regular review in the following way:
PrivateID’s privacy-preserving, on-device facial age estimation technology delivers precise age-related eligibility
decisions from any camera-enabled device in 20ms to determine whether a user is under, over, or a speciﬁed age.
The system accepts static images, images with multiple faces or video streams, returning a facial age estimation and
bounding box for each face along with conﬁdence indicators. Advanced on-device facial biometric models with
integrated liveness detection prevent spooﬁng, including deepfakes. Optional step-up workﬂows can be initiated for
users on the cusp of age thresholds by capturing a photo ID and performing on-device selﬁe-to-portrait matching with
DOB extraction. This provides additional age assurance while still maintaining complete user privacy as all processing
occurs on-device without any images or data leaving the device.
We safeguard user privacy with our patented Edge AI, which processes all data directly on the device, ensuring that
no images or personally identiﬁable information (PII) is transmitted or stored. This approach eliminates data breach
risks, meets strict privacy standards, and removes the need for user or parental consent as all processing is
performed on the users own device.
Our models are trained on 100% ethically sourced data, including synthetic images, to ensure unbiased performance
without compromising privacy. Committed to accessibility and inclusivity, our solution provides clear, real-time UI/UX
feedback in language and visuals that are easily understood by all users, enabling high user conversion rates on the
ﬁrst attempt.
Regular audits and certiﬁcations reinforce our commitment to excellence. An independent EAL3 audit and certiﬁcation
by the Age Check Certiﬁcation Scheme conﬁrmed that our system meets industry-leading standards for accuracy and
bias. Trusted by leading enterprises like Google, PrivateID continuously evaluates and enhances its solutions to
deliver optimal age assurance outcomes across the globe.
This solution is designed to test the following age eligibility requirements:
PrivateID uses its patented Edge AI technology to perform facial age estimation directly on the user’s
device—eliminating the need for user or parental consent and ensuring that no images or personally identiﬁable
information leave the device. Our solution delivers an above or below age threshold determination and/or a precise
age estimation with conﬁdence indicators.
Additionally, our patented on-device liveness detection veriﬁes that the user is genuine, eﬀectively blocking spooﬁng
techniques such as paper and digital presentation attacks, masks, and deepfakes. All age assurance solutions are
powered by our proprietary technology without any intermediaries.']
reference: Private Identity LLC, as an Age Assurance Provider, utilizes privacy-preserving, on-device facial age estimation technology to deliver precise age-related eligibility decisions from any camera-enabled device in 20ms. The system accepts static images, images with multiple faces, or video streams, returning a facial age estimation and bounding box for each face along with conﬁdence indicators. Advanced on-device facial biometric models with integrated liveness detection prevent spooﬁng, including deepfakes. The solution also includes optional step-up workflows for users on the cusp of age thresholds, capturing a photo ID and performing on-device selfie-to-portrait matching with DOB extraction, all while maintaining complete user privacy as all processing occurs on-device without any images or data leaving the device. PrivateID safeguards user privacy with its patented Edge AI, ensuring that no images or personally identifiable information (PII) is transmitted or stored, thus eliminating data breach risks and meeting strict privacy standards. The models are trained on 100% ethically sourced data, including synthetic images, to ensure unbiased performance without compromising privacy. Regular audits and certifications reinforce the commitment to excellence, with an independent EAL3 audit confirming that the system meets industry-leading standards for accuracy and bias.
response: The context provided does not contain specific information about the key features and privacy measures implemented by Private Identity LLC as an Age Assurance Provider. Therefore, I am unable to answer the question based on the given context.
